qas.question: How far from Nanjing is the Yangshan Quarry?

answers.text: 15–20 km (9–12 mi) east of the walled city

qas.question: What large item is abandoned at the Quarry?
How long ago was the stele abandoned?

answers.text: it was impossible to move or complete it

qas.question: Who ordered the creation of the stele?

context: A monument to the huge human cost of some of the gigantic construction projects of the early Ming dynasty is the Yangshan Quarry (located some <a0_0>15–20 km (9–12 mi) east of the walled city<a0_0/> and Ming Xiaoling mausoleum), where <a1_0>a gigantic stele<a1_0/>, cut on the orders of <a4_0>the Yongle Emperor<a4_0/>, lies abandoned, just as it was left <a2_0>600 years ago<a2_0/> when it was understood <a3_0>it was impossible to move or complete it<a3_0/>.
